text: Alexander boti(; born 31 December 1937) is a Hungarian-born Israeli biochemist and Nobel laureate in Chemistry. Along with Aaron Ciechanover and Irwin Rose, he was awarded the 2004 Nobel Prize in Chemistry for the discovery of ubiquitin-mediated protein degradation. ==References== Category:1937 births Category:Living people Category:Hungarian scientists Category:Israeli biologists
title: Avram Hershko
